name: Boston Park Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used Priceline "Name your price" and was given this hotel at a rate almost half of what was listed on the various booking and hotel sights. At the Priceline bid rate it was worth it. If I had paid the price listed, I may have been a bit disappointed. The room was small, dated, and the bathroom tiny. It was clean, and fairly quiet although you could hear people talking in the adjoining rooms. It looks like it's in need of a facelift. There were cracks on the ceiling, and other signs of wear and tear.
reviews.title: A Priceline deal that served the purpose

reviews.text: We were there for a quick weekend visit so it was adequate. The T (green line) was steps away from the front door. There's also a Starbucks and Au Bon Pain a block or so away, for a convenient, quick breakfast.
reviews.title: Great staff but smoke on floors unbearable!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is free WIFI in the seating area next to the restaurant (and in the restaurant as well), so no need to pay for it in the room.
reviews.title: yet aagain a great trip to Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We parked down the block at Central Parking (they have a $25 coupon for 24 hrs on their website). The hotel garage was $44 so this was a good deal.
reviews.title: Boston Park Plaza Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location excellent, atff worked really hard especially conference food/beverage/IT, meertings,. Rooms small and dated (bathroom- think cruise ship) but typical for a city location. What really ruined my weekened was the 3 calls a day I needed to make to security to report my neighbors on the 7th floor who were smoking non stop. Colleagues reported the same on the 8th and 14th floors. Our clothes, towels and linens really smelled bad. The hotel is non smoking and has a fine policy but clearly this not enforced, Worse is that in such an old building, a fire would be a disaster. The hotel needs to be proactive and police their smoking guests!!!!
reviews.title: Charming and unique.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in his hotel the second weekend in February. When I arrived it took 20 minutes to check in since they only had one person working the front desk. This is a time when Harvard University was holding a convention in the hotel so it was wall-to-wall students. The room was quite aged and it still had a tube type TV! The room was small without an easy chair to sit in so the only place to sit was on the bed. We were awakened on Sunday morning at eight o'clock by jackhammering and drilling. When we complained on check out, front desk person said there's no construction going on in the hotel even though I told her I would bring her up to the room so she could hear it the nonstop hammering and drilling which appear to be coming from the adjacent room. Small rooms, unsympathetic staff, having to walk down 11 flights of stairs because the elevators were so crowded, $40 per night parking and being awakened at eight o'clock by construction sounds make this a definite thumbs down
reviews.title: Stay Away unless your a heavy sleeper

reviews.text: Unfortunately a conference, sponsored by a local university, had taken place for two days prior to our arrival and the students left the hotel hallways, lobby and elevators full of trash which was still there the following morning. Plus, once checked out, the students hung around the lobby in groups apparently waiting for flights, again leaving trash on tables, etc, which also was not picked up by the time we returned from dinner later that night . Perhaps the hotel staff was overwhelmed. Its the only excuse I can think of to explain our experience.
reviews.title: I don't mind a dated hotel room but I do mind a dirty room with bedding held together with safety pins.

reviews.text: Our room had a very dirty heating unit which meant that when the heat was on it blew dust into the room. The shades were ripped. The bedskirt, which was ripped from the bottom of the bed to the headboard, was held together by safety pins. The Keurig coffee machine was filthy. We wiped it out with a tissue but decided to go to Au Bon Pain next door for coffee in the morning. I didn't expect a newly renovated hotel room but I also didn't expect a dirty room/hotel either. I was very disappointed and can assure you that next time my friends and I go to Boston, we will not stay at the Park Plaza. I must say that the hotel staff behind the desk was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, that is the only positive comment I can make about this hotel.
reviews.title: I love this hotel!

reviews.text: I have stayed in this great hotel numerous times. It is centrally located, a half block from the Arlington T stop and a block from the Public Garden. It is also easy to access when driving into Boston - not usually an easy thing to do. Wonderful restaurants are within walking distance as is fun shopping. The hotel has an elegant, old-world feeling to it. The rooms are large, furnished nicely and the beds are very comfortable. Some rooms even have two bathrooms, a plus when traveling with others. The staff has always been helpful when needed. This hotel is a great value for the cost, especially when booking using one of their many specials. I highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about our stay at the Park Plaza was fabulous. Check in was quick, the staff at the concierge desk were very helpful with everything from getting us Celtics tickets, to directing us to the "must see's" while we were in town. Our room was very clean and surprisingly large with two bathrooms. The rooms are very well insulated, so we didn't hear other guests in the hallways or the opening and closing of doors at all hours. The Plaza may not be the most modern hotel in town, but the history is great. Loved the "servidoor"! You can't beat the location with the Arlinginton T-station right out the front door. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: One Night Stay - Great Value
Terrible Stay
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Park Plaza last weekend to celebrate a special occasion. We had a reservation at Bonfire, the hotel downstairs, and a "deluxe" room at the hotel.

reviews.title: The Great Towers Swindle
reviews.text: Bonfire was excellent, and the hotel lobby and public areas are all nice enough. It's been pointed out that the place is a bit frayed around the edges, and I'd agree with that. For the most part, though, the place is nice, if dated.

reviews.title: Faded glory
reviews.text: The problem is that the walls are paper thin and it seems like they're catering to rowdy, loud clientele. Around midnight the floor we were on, which was the eight floor, apparently turned into the party floor, with kids (late teens, early twenties) running around, yelling down the hallways, loud music, etc. It was like being in a college dorm

reviews.title: grande dame with small rooms
reviews.text: We called the front desk and after some discussion were moved elsewhere. That seemed to solve the problem until around 3:00 in the morning, when something similar happened in the new room. I went downstairs to talk to the front desk in person, and was told that the noise was probably because the bars had just closed and that everyone was coming home. From what I could tell, a fight between drunken idiots had broken out diown the hall, and this guy was giving the "aw shucks, just people heading home after a night of fun" routine. He did point out that it could be worse with a "you should see the eight floor", which, of course, was where I started.

reviews.title: Location and charm but...
reviews.text: Ultimately, a manager appeared and was at least apologetic about the whole thing. They also refunded the charge for the room, which I do give them credit for. I think the problem is that the weekend rates are pretty low, which attracts guests who wouldn't otherwise stay at a "luxury" hotel, the walls are too thin, and they don't really have adequate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was everything we were looking for. It's right in the middle of everything in Boston. Directly across the street from the Boston Commons and close to a subway stop. We booked this hotel at a very good rate through Expedia. We expected to pay over $350 a night since we stayed over the holiday weekend but found prices around $200.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay!

likes.disliked: — Wish there would have been a cheap place to eat breakfast on property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a deluxe king room and it had more than enough room. Everything was very clean and the staff were very friendly. They gave us great tips and directions on anything we needed. Make sure to put your "do not disturb" sign on the door when you are sleeping because the maids do knock quite early.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Boston

likes.disliked: — Would have liked a lounge chair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitley suggest staying at the Boston Park Plaza.
reviews.title: PFFF, what a disappointment!
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: We booked the Park Plaza for 3 nights over the 4th of July holiday. We chose the hotel because my wife had stayed there for business a year ago and knew it would be convenient for all of the sites we wanted to see in downtown Boston. It is close to Boston Common and has close subway access and is within walking distance (a few miles) of all the major attractions and historic sites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a King Deluxe room which was a very large room - much bigger than the standard room my wife had stayed in previously and a very generous size for a downtown hotel. The room was very comfortable with new pillow top bedding and white linen bed covers, a desk and two armless chairs (I would have preferred a lounge chair as there was room) and a flat screen TV on top of a 6 drawer dresser. I believe this room had once been two smaller rooms as there were 2 bathrooms - one with a tub shower and one with a stall shower. However typical of downtown hotels both bathrooms were quite small with limited shelf space so having two made the small size workable. The shower bathroom lacked a niche for soap/shampoo and the toilets in both bathrooms were packed in pretty tight quarters.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a very good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Boston Park Plaza after an event in the area. We had been looking forward to our stay because of the hotel's prestigious reputation. I can't think of any reason why they would receive such praise. We found the hotel to be terribly outdated. This hotel is about 25 years late for a remodel. The walls were desperately in need of painting. The AC barely worked as well.
reviews.title: Not very good at all
There are better places to stay ...
reviews.text: Now for the biggest reason I'll never return: We paid an awful lot of money for some pretty terrible service. It was really hard to find anyone at the hotel that seemed to care about providing help with anything. It seemed like nobody wanted to be there. Certainly nobody working there was in a rush to do anything. If you wanted to check in you had to wait in line for 20-30 minutes. You want help with your bags on checkout? Wait another 30 minutes then go down to the lobby and get someone with a cart yourself.

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.text: I should have know the service would be bad when every time I had to call the hotel, I would be on hold constantly or put right into voicemail.
There are many better high end option in Boston than the Park Plaza.
reviews.title: We loved it!

likes.liked: — Location, private lounge and concierge services

reviews.text: I stayed here for a work conference and was disappointed by the rooms and the service. The lobby is beautiful and the location blocks from the Public Garden can't be beat, but this property is really in need of some upgrades.
reviews.title: Hit and Miss

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Park Plaza this week, when we decided to add a night to a kid-friendly museum trip. I jumped on Hotwire and found a room at the Park Plaza for a very good rate; knowing the location and having seen the public spaces, I thought it was a good bet. We were not disappointed!
reviews.title: Ever-so-slightly faded glory -- for a great price

likes.liked: — Old-time elegance for a great price, great location
likes.disliked: — Parking in downtown Boston is expensive and a hassle

reviews.text: At eighty years old, the Park Plaza recalls a grander era of travel. The hotel has been well maintained over the years, and, while there are signs of wear-and-tear, they in no way diminished our enjoyment of the comfortable room we had on the 11th floor. The room was nicely decorated, the beds cozy, the bathroom small but well appointed -- and had the power to transport you back to the Deco era, with its lovely mosaic tile. As my kids said, "Wow! Fancy!".
reviews.title: A boutique hotel warmth with utmost professionalism.

likes.liked: — The beds were comfortable,the staff was extremely helpful
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping can be a little more tidious and careful

reviews.text: "Wow! Fancy!" works equally well for the lobby and other public spaces. Maybe I have spent too much time in anonymous business hotels in the last year, but the warmth of the Park Plaza, even if it's just a bit tatty around the edges, really made me feel good.
reviews.title: Classy Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — It was a Pepsi-exclusive facility -- great for my husband but not for me

reviews.text: The Park Plaza is in an excellent location, close to the Theater District, the Boston Common, etc. We were thrilled to fall out the door and walk a minute to the nearby Legal Seafoods for a wonderful family meal that really warmed us on a cold, rainy Boston night. There are several good restaurants right on the property (speculating here -- but I would imagine the Todd English steakhouse, Bonfire is worth a try)... and my kids were once again wowwed by the hotel restaurant's breakfast buffet (really just average for a high-end hotel, but a nice change for two kids I dragged to the hinterlands of New Hampshire).
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.text: Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Park Plaza. The combination of a great value and a flashback to a more elegant time had us immediately planning a return trip...
reviews.title: Boston Park Plaza - Avoid at All Costs

reviews.text: I recently managed travel for a group of about 30 people who were in and out of Boston during the month of January, each on a different schedule. Due to weather and changes in our project, arrival and departure dates were changing constantly. The hotel’s sales team gave us extraordinary service, responding to all our changes immediately. We even made a number of last minute reservations on weekends and evenings that went through the front desk, which were also all handled efficiently, including our special needs. Our folks, designers and technical personnel, were extremely happy with the hotel and its services, and I was thrilled with the both the service and price. Thank you Park Plaza, and especially Lauren and Johanna.
reviews.title: The hotel's sales team gave us extraordinary service.
Beautiful lobby, grea.t location with small rooms. "Extras" are $$$$$
reviews.text: This was the second we stayed at this hotel in the past five years. The location is great with the green line a block away and the commuter rail about four. The lobby is beautiful and has the golden era ritzy feel. The rooms are small and need a little freshness (the hotel opened in 1927). Service and staff are helpfull, polite and professional. Parking, room service and the restaurants are pricey; there are better deals elsewhere (MJ O'Connors). We stayed on the coldest days since 2006 and the hotel had some heating issues (along with the rest of the city). They did what was humanly possible to help and it really wasn't an inconvience. Would I stay here again? Yes for the right price. If you go in the warmer times of year you can walk to almost everything. And if you can't walk the green and red lines are nearby.
We were very pleased for the most part with our stay during the holiday which included an extra night due to the winter storm.
reviews.title: Nice stay for the Christmas Holiday

reviews.text: The front desk staff were professional and very helpful, as were the staff in the breakfast restaurant , tea and lounge bar.
reviews.title: Is this what Astronauts experience? So cold. So cold.

reviews.text: The rooms were nice, updated some.
reviews.title: My home away from home in Boston...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First Night, Heater keeps making noises and i couldn't get rid of it , so i called and then a maintenance guy came up. I tried to explain the situation and i think he said i had to turn it off or something ( i couldn't understand him because he didn't seem to know how to speak English) .........so no heater at night for me....
reviews.title: Very noisy at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second day morning, housekeepers knocked my door really loud in the morning at 9:30 am, as well as other guest's door. ( I heard around 10 very LOUD knocks) inside my room and not only knocks, housekeeper's voice was loud as well.
reviews.title: You must be joking
Will Not Return to Park Plaza
reviews.text: Second night, people next door were really loud at 2:30 a.m in the middle of night.
Third day morning, we put a do not disturb sign outside so housekeepers didn't knock on our door , but i can still hear every knock on other guests' rooms.
reviews.title: Great!!! Would return in a heartbeat.

likes.disliked: — If I had to be picky...maybe the elevators?

reviews.text: Third night , loud neighbors as usual.
reviews.title: Colonial Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's very hard to find an affordable hotel room in Boston for some reason (more than any other city I've stayed in) so we decided to take Friday off when visiting here as the price was half that of Saturday night. Still expensive, but that just seems to be Boston!
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel with history!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway - gorgeous hotel. It's right on the Common, and is only a short walk from South Station. The hotel feels nice and historic - the lobby is beautiful. Our room was very nice - not huge but plenty big enough with a large very comfy bed. The bathroom was again small but was spotlessly clean and very cute and the shower was wonderfully strong.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in excellent location

reviews.text: We ended up eating in one of the hotel restaurants - the newly opened Melting Pot which was fun - lots of different types of fondue.
reviews.title: This was probably one of the most beautiful hotels that I have ever stayed in.

reviews.text: Any staff we spoke too were very friendly and helpful. I'd go back again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel, located in the Back Bay area of Boston, is perfect for tourists in Boston. Prices are very reasonable, and you get quite a lot for your money.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Boston!

reviews.text: I happened to be visiting Boston, unwittingly over Harvard and MIT graduation weekend. I tried to get a hotel for weeks but there was not a room in the city until I tried Priceline for the umpteenth time and got a room at the Park Plaza for $200. As it happened, it couldn't have been a better choice. The hotel is located right in the middle of the heart of Back Bay, close to all the shops and restaurants. The lobby is stunning, in an old European kind of way, and was full of gorgeous flowers. The bell captain, concierge and front desk could not have been more helpful, I was impressed at their professionalism in the midst of all the chaos of a full hotel.
reviews.title: Park Plaza: on the whole I was satisfied

likes.liked: — Location, location, location! Value for money. Cleanliness. Nice staff. Beautiful lobby. Wonderful bed.
likes.disliked: — Only that the ethernet cable was faulty in my room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elevators, lobby and corridors are lovely. My room was very nice, too. My bed was wonderful, with loads of fluffy pillows and a duvet and really crisp sheets. The view was nice from the 14th floor. It seemed as though the room had recently been upgraded because the decor was beautiful. The bathroom was marble with stainless fixtures, plenty of hot water, a little cramped but the fluffy towels and the depth of the bath made up for that. Everything was super spotless. I was extremely happy. My only problem was that there is no wifi. The ethernet cable stretched about 18" and the plug would not stay in my computer. I didn't ask for another one because I was in and out doing stuff and could manage but that could be a problem for a business traveler.
reviews.title: great location....nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One very nice thing happened, I had put a doorhanger on my door to say I did want USA Today. But there was no USA Today. I asked the staff for one, and a nice gentleman arrived within two minutes with a copy for me. I thought that was impressive because these days you don't usually get service like that.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I was very happy with the hotel. No complaints from me.
reviews.title: Very Upscale

reviews.text: Decided last minute to stay in town after getting tickets to the Celtics game..
reviews.title: Wonderful
wilson
reviews.text: Noisy hotel although on the 5th floor, clean their windows at 2am,not good when you have a flight to catch but the consiege seems to think this is perfectly reasonable. would not recommend this hotel

reviews.title: Elevator Safety Issues!!
reviews.text: All three of the south bank of elevators malfunctioned the entire four days we were there! One group of guests was stuck in elevator #3 for over an hour and a half.

My wife and I got stuck between floors twice in elevators #1 and 2 two days in a row when the electronics suddenly just went dead. After fiddling with the buttons it started up again each time after about five minutes.
reviews.title: Overpriced shoebox

reviews.text: I believe these sorts of maintenance/safety issues are unforgivable in a hotel this expensive and we will not be staying there again!
reviews.title: Less than what I expected

reviews.text: I would not stay at this hotel again if it was free. I paid an exorbitant amount for two nights for a room that was not even big enough to accommodate a standard (double) bed. In fact, it was so small that the bedside table would not fit next to the bed and was at the foot of the bed.
reviews.title: Classic though slightly shabby; great location

reviews.text: Location excellent. Rooms need refurbishing. Door man not attentive - and doors are very heavy. Concierge tried to sell us tickets for a sightseeing trolley that was NOT running that day because of the weather.
reviews.title: Satisfactory

reviews.text: I just returned from attending a two day symposium at the Boston Park Plaza. Having never been three before, I turned to TripAdvisor for some of their reviews. Some were good, but most were mediocre at best. Such direct criticisms as 'old paint, broken tiles, dirty carpets' made me less than enthusiastic about the choice of hotels.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been any better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And they couldn't have been more wrong. My stay at the Boston Park Plaza was one of the best business stays of recent history. One review suggested getting a room with a 'road view'....and I followed this suggestion (room 533). The room was spotless, the bed inviting, the bathroom sparkling.....and the view was very nice. The meeting room was elegant, and handled the relatively large crowd (~120) quite nicely. Arrived just in time to catch the Superbowl at the adjoining McCormick & Schmick Restaurant. All I can say is.......SUPER!
reviews.title: Big name, small room

reviews.text: I was expecting a 4-5 star hotel, but the rooms were definitely not. The lobby is beautiful, staff is friendly and the hotel bar, Whiskey Park, is amazing. I guess a room is a room, but it needs updating. The bathroom was from the 1970's and the ac/heat unit barely worked. Their rooms come with double beds and they charge extra if you want a queen bed and charge more for a king bed. The doors to the rooms were all cracked and they have an outdated lock system. The room was cheaper than other hotels near by. Not as extravagant as I thought it would be.
reviews.title: One night makes a difference!

reviews.text: My 14year old daughter and I traveled to Boston for one nights stay but Boy did it make a difference!
reviews.title: Location location location (affordable luxury)

reviews.text: I booked a 1 night stay for a nonsmoking room with a King bed.
reviews.title: Leaves alot to be desired

reviews.text: Check in went well, but upon arrival in the room it was obvious that the previous guest had been a heavy smoker and the room reeked. (The room had just been made up and the chambermaid showed us all the spray and machine that she had used to try and eliminate the stench). In addition the bed was clearly a queen size. We went back to check in and reported the above. With regard to the bed size we were told that the king beds at the park plaza are like queen beds anywhere else ( an interesting comment I thought). We were nonetheless given a new room as I insisted that I could not sleep in a room which smelt from smoke. Our new room had a true king size bed and was smoke free. Fine. Early Sat.morning (7:45) the chambermaid opens the door to come and clean our room, thereby awakening us - a might early for a weekend day! When I mentioned this at the front desk no apology or explanation was offered. Not a pleasant experience!
reviews.title: Loved the Park Plaza!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Park Plaza. We got a great rate from Travel Zoo, $159 a night. Our room was beautiful, two full size beds, lots of pillows and two bathrooms, one on each side of the room. That was a pleasant surprise upon check in. The area was very nice, alot of restaurants nearby. The lobby was grand and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. We had forgot to pack toothpaste. So I went to the lobby to ask where I could buy some, along with a place nearby to pick up coffee. They asked my name and within a few minutes my husband said they sent someone up with toothpaste. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Good rooom, good location, luke warm reception...

reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Plaza for the first three nights of our honeymoon from 25 to 28 Aug before travelling on to New York. We stayed in a 'Deluxe Room - 1 King'. Our room was on the fifth floor I think and was definitely not small. It looked like it used to be two rooms that had been knocked together but the result was excellent. One of the biggest hotel rooms I've stayed in actually.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The room and bathroom were clean and well kept. The cleaning staff kept the place really well. The only downside was our reception on arrival, but I can put that down to one dodgy member of staff because the others were quite nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, fab location. Can't fault it really.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The friendly accommodating staff and the comfy bed!

reviews.text: We had a Standard room which was more than adequate. I'm sure that some people could find it on the small side, but we didn't have a problem with it at all. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (Random, but makes a difference when you're jet-lagged and need sleep!). The walls must have been pretty thick, cos we didn't have any disturbance from neighbours at all and we had 3 xmas parties while we there and we didn't hear a thing. The only down-side was that the windows could not have been double-glazed, as we had noise from outside. Unfortunately, we were the entrance side of the hotel so had the noise of taxi's etc. However, didn't disturb sleep especially (Don't let it put you off).
reviews.title: Showing its age but good service and location

reviews.text: All the staff were really helpful and friendly. Lobby looked great dressed for the festive season. We had a complimentary breakfast, which was great...Loads of choice and good quality, but not sure we would have had it if it was not free (Full breakfast is expensive at $18.50 each).
reviews.title: I enjoyed the hotel

likes.disliked: — It's an old hotel, I prefer modern hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is fantastic, within walking distance of pretty much everything. Boston is a great city. Would definately go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the hotel

reviews.text: I was booked into this hotel for business travel. One thing off the bat is that even though starwood owns the hotel, they do not offer SPG points! That is pretty odd.
reviews.title: mainly positive, but primary advantage is its location

likes.disliked: — a bit threadbare, not as clean as it could be, and some of the staff weren't at their best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I got an amazing deal for a 1 night stay, so decided to go for the night. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is very elegant. We did battle to find the check in desk as it is on the opposite side to the parking.
reviews.title: Great Location...

reviews.text: Also, there is valet parking only-for a $30 a night fee!!
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, but that’s about all to recommend this hotel.

likes.disliked: — Condition of the room - would recommend only to people traveling on a budget, looking for central location.

reviews.text: The room was a bit small and the heating system was quite noisy. However it was very clean and presentable.
reviews.title: Not so great.
Old, pretty hotel
reviews.text: We loved the location of the hotel. The in-house restaurant is very expensive, however, a few blocks away is Cheers, and of course many other restaurants in the are.

First, to distinguish, when I checked in I asked if I could get Starwood points for my stay. The hotel said that only half was a Starwood property - so as you are reading reviews, check if the review distinguishes between the “Towers” (Starwood side - more expensive, and probably nicer), and the rest of the hotel. To be clear, the review below is for the non-Towers side. I stayed in a Single King Size room, approx. 300 sq. ft. based on the Expedia description. The review for this size room/hotel is as follows:
reviews.title: Nice hotel!

likes.liked: — the location, within walking distance of restaurants and shops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel lobby with a great location. A little pricey for the room. Stayed four nights and could not get the houskeeper to clean the tub. Left notes, but they were ignored. I'll look at other hotels my next stay.
reviews.title: Poor Housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. We stayed for 1 week. The room was clean, spacious and very comfortable and the hotel clean and nice. The staff were helpful and friendly and gym was good. The location was perfect and very close to transport links.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel - great location

reviews.text: Only negatives: Concierge desk always had a queue and only seemed to have a single person serving. The maids knocked at 08:00 sometimes which wasn't very welcome on holiday!
reviews.title: great location near Boston Common, Theaters and Chinatown

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great location, rooms questionable

reviews.text: Wonderful downtown location. Near Boston Common, Theaters and Chinatown. 2 blocks from two different T stops (train).
reviews.title: Stay someplace else!
Great location
reviews.text: My husband & I booked a one night stay in Boston and chose the Park Plaza for its location: near Boston Common, Newbury & Boylston St. shopping. Our room wasn't ready upon arrival around 3pm. They said it would be ready about an hour later. No big deal; we went out for a walk & a drink. Upon our return we were able to check in. I recommend booking a deluxe king (as opposed to the standard king) for the extra space if the difference in price is nominal...it's worth it.

reviews.title: fenway park
reviews.text: The room & bathroom were very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable (9 pillows!) The shower was dual-head and we had plenty of hot water. Although the rooms around us were occupied, we didn't hear any "neighbor noise" except for doors opening/shutting in the a.m.

Just two issues: a banging noise when the heat kicked on a couple of times in the night.... It was loud enough to wake me up each time. Also, it took several toilet flushes for the water to sufficiently drain each time we flushed. Didn't especially care for that.
reviews.title: Good conference venue

reviews.text: A note about breakfast to fellow tourists: we wanted to find a cool breakfast spot (not the hotel breakfast buffet) the next morning and the concierge recommended a popular place - The Paramount on Charles St - about a 10-15 walk from the hotel....we got there and the wait was long and we decided not to wait.....didn't see any other breakfast spots (other than coffee/muffin places) in our wanderings, so we actually just went back to the hotel for the buffet....it was $20 a piece but the food was plentiful and perfectly fine(eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, bagels, salmon, omelet bar, pastries, fruit, etc.) If you're famished in the morning, and not up for a walk & a wait, that is probably the way to go.
reviews.title: Nice hotel- good location

reviews.text: Our first trip to Boston and we can't wait to return. My husband's dream was to see NY Yankees play at Fenway Park. The dream became a reality. We stayed at the Boston Park Plaza which we found to be a great central place to stay. It was located within walking distance to a wide assortment of things to see and do. Boston Common Park, Cheers bar!, Gray Line bus depot, Fanueil Market, Fenway Park, Commonwealth area and Copley Place to name a few. Everyone at Park Plaza were friendly and helpful. The room was great with the exception of the small counter space surrounding the bathroom sink. A little over priced at $399.00 a night. and food a bit pricey so we ate elsewhere. We felt safe at any time of the day as we were walking, walking, walking.
reviews.title: Nicer than I expected

likes.disliked: — Breakfast selection OK. We went outside to Au Bon Pain each day

reviews.text: I paid a fraction of the standard room price by booking through Priceline.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Boston Park Plaza is the only hotel 3* that they have in the Boston Common area, so there was no risk of getting something that I didn't want when bidding through the website.
reviews.title: Not sure why the bad reviews

reviews.text: I was a little concerned when reading other Trip Advisor reviews that mentioned budget rooms, that were of a lower standard but thankfully I have no complaints.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel has been refurbished and the three rooms that we booked were all of a very good standard.
reviews.title: Private Bath in Every Room
Confirmed reservation not honoured ruined our last day, May 2008
reviews.text: The hotel was better than some 4* hotels that I have stayed in but I assume the lack of bathrobes and sily things like that are the elements that keep it at a 3*.

We booked a hotel on Priceline and this is what we got. It is a nice hotel for the price we paid (less than $100.00) but nothing great. The lobby is outstanding but the rooms are average. The carpet could be replaced. The front desk clerk we interacted with seemed robotic and indifferent. I will say the food from room service was outstanding, although a bit pricey. I would stay here again at the rate we received from Priceline but would not pay full rate for this hotel.
reviews.title: An OK Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights after Christmas with my mum. Having read previous reviews and previously stayed in the Sheraton can't say I was expecting greatness!! How wrong I was though, this hotel was fantastic!! Location, Staff, Rooms, Bar etc can't complain about anything!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel...Great Location
I Had A Great Time There
reviews.text: Will definitely stay here again.

I have no clue why some of the reviews of the Boston Park Plaza are less than complimentary. I stayed there Feb. 6-9, 2008, and had a wonderful time. First, you cannot get a better location. Plenty of shopping and scads of terrific restaurants all within one block of the hotel on all four sides. The hotel room was not large, but it was large enough with a wonderful sturdy king bed with all the frills (pillows, quilts, etc.) you could ask for. Pleny of drawer and closet space. A nice 25" TV. The bathroom was small, but the shower--with two shower heads--was as good a shower as I have ever had at any hotel. The staff was very personable. The business center charged $10 for 30 minutes on the internet and I had no problem with that at all. When I go back to Boston, I'm staying there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — Beautiful accomodations, great staff, central location.
likes.disliked: — Room was smallish, but not a problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend and I had to attend a conference at the new Westin. We were too cheap to pay to stay there. The Park Plaza was very nice. She scored a great rate on hotwire - less than $60 a night. The room and bathroom were smallish, but beautiful and clean. The lobby and staff were warm and accomodating. Would definitely stay again. The location is very central to downtown Boston. Plenty of things to do and places to eat very close.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference. Beautiful lobby and very friendly staff. The rooms are a bit on the small side and a bit noisy with the subway and street noise. Probably would request a higher room if I stay here again.
reviews.title: Elegant, good location, noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place - the hotel is beautiful it looked so gorgeous with all the Christmas deco's up just beautiful - we must have been upgraded to a deluxe room it had a BIG bed and a lovely big bathroom spotless and comfy - would recommend this to anyone - city was great too - not a place for shopping though.
reviews.title: Lovely Christmas location
Great stay (apart from the TV internet)

UK and got checked in early, Grand lobby area make for a
reviews.title: Good value but don't use the TV Internet

likes.liked: — Location near Newbury Street and Boylston Street.

reviews.text: impressive entrace, Room wasnt large but then again wasnt
reviews.title: The name is biger that the Hotel

aka: The Boston Park Plaza Hotel And Towers
description: Located in the heart of historic Back Bay, The Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers is located only 3 miles from Logan International Airport and only 200 yards from the nation’s first public parks, Boston Common & the Public Garden. The hotel is easily accessible to shopping along world renowned Newbury Street, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, the Theatre & Financial Districts and most historic landmarks.
